get.summary: Gets the API user's list of alerts
get.description: Gets the API user's list of alerts

parameters.name: cutoff
parameters.description: Unix timestamp of oldest alert to include. Note that unread or unviewed alerts are always included.

parameters.name: unviewed
parameters.description: If true, gets only unviewed alerts. Unviewed alerts have not been seen (in the standard UI).

parameters.name: unread
parameters.description: If true, gets only unread alerts. Unread alerts may have been seen but the content they relate to has not been viewed.

post.summary: Sends an alert to the specified user
post.description: Sends an alert to the specified user. Only available to super user keys.

to_user_id.description: ID of the user to receive the alert

alert.description: Text of the alert. May use the placeholder "{link}" to have the link automatically inserted.

from_user_id.description: If provided, the user to send the alert from. Otherwise, uses the current API user. May be 0 for an anonymous alert.

link_url.description: URL user will be taken to when the alert is clicked.

link_title.description: Text of the link URL that will be displayed. If no placeholder is present in the alert, will be automatically appended.

to_user_id.description: ID of the user to receive the alert

alert.description: Text of the alert. May use the placeholder "{link}" to have the link automatically inserted.

from_user_id.description: If provided, the user to send the alert from. Otherwise, uses the current API user. May be 0 for an anonymous alert.

link_url.description: URL user will be taken to when the alert is clicked.

link_title.description: Text of the link URL that will be displayed. If no placeholder is present in the alert, will be automatically appended.

post.summary: Marks all of the API user's alerts as read or viewed
post.description: Marks all of the API user's alerts as read or viewed. Must specify "read" or "viewed" parameters.

read.description: If specified, marks all alerts as read.

viewed.description: If specified, marks all alerts as viewed. This will remove the alert counter but keep unactioned alerts highlighted.

read.description: If specified, marks all alerts as read.

viewed.description: If specified, marks all alerts as viewed. This will remove the alert counter but keep unactioned alerts highlighted.

get.summary: Gets information about the specified alert
get.description: Gets information about the specified alert

post.summary: Marks the alert as viewed/read/unread
post.description: Marks the alert as viewed/read/unread. (Marking as unviewed is not supported.)

read.description: If specified, marks the alert as read.

unread.description: If specified, marks the alert as unread.

viewed.description: If specified, marks all alerts as viewed.

read.description: If specified, marks the alert as read.

unread.description: If specified, marks the alert as unread.

viewed.description: If specified, marks all alerts as viewed.

get.summary: Gets the attachments associated with the provided API attachment key
get.description: Gets the attachments associated with the provided API attachment key. Only returns attachments that have not been associated with content.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The API attachment key

post.summary: Uploads an attachment
post.description: Uploads an attachment. An API attachment key must be created first. Must be submitted using multipart/form-data encoding.

key.description: The API attachment key to associated with
The API attachment key to associated with

attachment.description: The attachment record of the successful upload

400.description:
Possible errors:
- `attachment_key_user_wrong`: Triggered if the user making the request does not match the user that created the attachment key.

post.summary: Creates a new attachment key, allowing attachments to be uploaded separately from the related content
post.description: Creates a new attachment key, allowing attachments to be uploaded separately from the related content.

type.description: The content type of the attachment. Default types include post, conversation_message. Add-ons may add more.

context.description: Key-value pairs representing the context of the attachment. This will vary depending on content type and the action being taken. See relevant actions for further details.

attachment.description: The first attachment to be associated with the new key.

type.description: The content type of the attachment. Default types include post, conversation_message. Add-ons may add more.

context.description: Key-value pairs representing the context of the attachment. This will vary depending on content type and the action being taken. See relevant actions for further details.

attachment.description: The first attachment to be associated with the new key.

key.description: The attachment key created. This should be used to upload additional files or to associate uploaded attachments with other content.

attachment.description: If a file was provided and the upload was successful, this will describe the new attachment.

get.summary: Gets information about the specified attachment
get.description: Gets information about the specified attachment.

get.summary: Gets the data that makes up the specified attachment
get.description: Gets the data that makes up the specified attachment. The output is the raw binary data.

data.description: The binary data is output directly, not JSON.

get.summary: Gets the URL to the attachment's thumbnail, if it has one
get.description: Gets the URL to the attachment's thumbnail, if it has one. URL returned via a 301 redirect.

url.description: The URL to the thumbnail is returned via a 301 redirect's Location header.

400.description:
Possible errors:
- `not_found`: Not found if the attachment does not have a thumbnail

get.summary: Gets the URL to the attachment's thumbnail, if it has one
get.description: Gets the URL to the attachment's thumbnail, if it has one. URL returned via a 301 redirect.

url.description: The URL to the thumbnail is returned via a 301 redirect's Location header.

400.description:
Possible errors:
- `not_found`: Not found if the attachment does not have a thumbnail

post.summary: Tests a login and password for validity
post.description: Tests a login and password for validity. Only available to super user keys. We strongly recommend the login and password parameters are passed into the request body rather than the query string.

login.description: The username or email address of the user to test

limit_ip.description: The IP that should be considered to be making the request. If provided, this will be used to prevent brute force attempts.

login.description: The username or email address of the user to test

limit_ip.description: The IP that should be considered to be making the request. If provided, this will be used to prevent brute force attempts.

user.description: If successful, the user record of the matching user

post.summary: Looks up the active XenForo user based on session ID or remember cookie value
post.description: Looks up the active XenForo user based on session ID or remember cookie value. This can be used to help with seamless SSO with XF, assuming the session or remember cookies are available to your page. At least one of session_id and remember_cookie must be provided. Only available to super user keys.

session_id.description: If provided, checks for an active session with that ID.

remember_cookie.description: If provided, checks to see if this is an active "remember me" cookie value.

session_id.description: If provided, checks for an active session with that ID.

remember_cookie.description: If provided, checks to see if this is an active "remember me" cookie value.

success.description: If false, no session or remember cookie could be found

user.description: If successful, the user record of the matching user. May be a guest.

post.summary: Generates a token that can automatically log into a specific XenForo user when the login URL is visited
post.description: Generates a token that can automatically log into a specific XenForo user when the login URL is visited. If the visitor is already logged into a XenForo account, they will not be logged into the specified account. Only available to super user keys.

limit_ip.description: If provided, locks the token to the specified IP for additional security

return_url.description: If provided, after logging the user will be returned to this URL. Otherwise they'll go to the XenForo index.

force.description: If provided, the login URL will forcibly replace the currently logged in user if a user is already logged in and different to the currently logged in user. Defaults to false.

remember.description: Controls whether the a "remember me" cookie will be set when the user logs in. Defaults to true.

limit_ip.description: If provided, locks the token to the specified IP for additional security

return_url.description: If provided, after logging the user will be returned to this URL. Otherwise they'll go to the XenForo index.

force.description: If provided, the login URL will forcibly replace the currently logged in user if a user is already logged in and different to the currently logged in user. Defaults to false.

remember.description: Controls whether the a "remember me" cookie will be set when the user logs in. Defaults to true.

login_url.description: Direct user to this URL to trigger a login

expiry_date.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires. An error will be displayed if the token is expired or invalid

post.description: Replies to a conversation

attachment_key.description: API attachment key to upload files. Attachment key content type must be conversation_message with context[conversation_id] set to this conversation ID.
API attachment key to upload files. Attachment key content type must be conversation_message with context[conversation_id] set to this conversation ID.

post.description: Creates a conversation

recipient_ids.description: List of user IDs to send the conversation to

open_invite.description: If true, any member of the conversation may add others

conversation_open.description: If false, no further replies are allowed.

open_invite.description: If true, any member of the conversation can add others

conversation_open.description: If false, no further replies are allowed.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified conversation from the API user's list
delete.description: Deletes the specified conversation from the API user's list. Does not delete the conversation for other receivers.

parameters.name: ignore
parameters.description: If true, further replies to this conversation will be ignored. (Otherwise, replies will restore this conversation to the list.)

tags.description: Array of tag names to apply to the thread.

custom_fields[<name>].description: Value to apply to the custom field with the specified name.

last_post.description: If requested, information about the last post in the thread.

pinned_post.description: The pinned first post of the thread, if specified by the thread type.

highlighted_posts.description: A list of highlighted posts, if relevant to the thread type. The reason for highlighting depends on thread type.

posts.description: List of posts on the requested page. Note that even if the first post is pinned, it will be included here.

post.summary: Moves the specified thread to a different forum

prefix_id.description: If set, will update the thread's prefix. Prefix must be valid in the target forum.

title.description: If set, updates the thread's title

notify_watchers.description: If true, users watching the target forum will receive a notification as if this thread were created in the target forum

starter_alert.description: If true, the thread starter will receive an alert notifying them of the move

starter_alert_reason.description: The reason for the move to include with the thread starter alert

prefix_id.description: If set, will update the thread's prefix. Prefix must be valid in the target forum.

title.description: If set, updates the thread's title

notify_watchers.description: If true, users watching the target forum will receive a notification as if this thread were created in the target forum

starter_alert.description: If true, the thread starter will receive an alert notifying them of the move

starter_alert_reason.description: The reason for the move to include with the thread starter alert

get.summary: Gets a page of posts in the specified conversation
get.description: Gets a page of posts in the specified conversation.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Request a particular sort order for posts from the available options for the thread type

pinned_post.description: The pinned first post of the thread, if specified by the thread type.

highlighted_posts.description: A list of highlighted posts, if relevant to the thread type. The reason for highlighting depends on thread type.

posts.description: List of posts on the requested page. Note that even if the first post is pinned, it will be included here.

post.summary: Deletes the feature for the specified thread
post.description: Deletes the feature for the specified thread

post.summary: Votes on the specified thread (if applicable)
post.description: Votes on the specified thread (if applicable)

type.description: Type of vote, "up" or "down". Use the current type to undo.
Type of vote, "up" or "down". Use the current type to undo.

action.description: "insert" or "delete" based on whether the reaction was added or removed.

get.summary: Gets a list of users (alphabetically)
get.description: Gets a list of users (alphabetically)

post.summary: Creates a user
post.description: Creates a user.

username_change_visible.description: If true and the username is changed, the change will be visible (shown in the public list of previous usernames).
If true and the username is changed, the change will be visible (shown in the public list of previous usernames).

get.summary: Finds users by their email
get.description: Finds users by their email. Only available to admin users (or when bypassing permissions).

user.description: The user that matched the given email exactly

get.summary: Finds users by a prefix of their user name
get.description: Finds users by a prefix of their user name.

exact.description: The user that matched the given username exactly

recommendations.description: A list of users that match the prefix of the username (but not exactly)

get.summary: Gets information about the specified user
get.description: Gets information about the specified user.

parameters.name: with_posts
parameters.description: If specified, the response will include a page of profile posts.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of comments to include

profile_posts.description: List of profile posts on the requested page

post.summary: Updates an existing user
post.description: Updates an existing user.

username_change_visible.description: If true and the username is changed, the change will be visible (shown in the public list of previous usernames).
If true and the username is changed, the change will be visible (shown in the public list of previous usernames).

parameters.name: rename_to
parameters.description: If specified, the user will be renamed before deletion

post.summary: Updates the specified user's avatar

username.description: Name of the user that started the conversation

recipients.description: Key-value pair of recipient user IDs and names

is_starred.description: True if the viewing user starred the conversation

is_unread.description: If accessing as a user, true if this conversation is unread
If accessing as a user, true if this conversation message is unread

message_parsed.description: HTML parsed version of the message contents.

Conversation.description: If requested by context, the conversation this message is part of.

Attachments.description: If there are attachments to this message, a list of attachments.

is_reacted_to.description: True if the viewing user has reacted to this content

visitor_reaction_id.description: If the viewer reacted, the ID of the reaction they used

feature_user_id.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

unfeature_date.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

auto_featured.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

always_visible.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

unfeature_days.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

is_customized.description: Present for members with permission to feature or unfeature the content

breadcrumbs.description: A list of breadcrumbs for this node, including the node_id, title, and node_type_id

type_data.description: Data related to the specific node type this represents. Contents will vary significantly.

responses.description: List of possible responses with text, vote count (if visible) and whether the API user has voted for each

is_unread.description: If accessing as a user, true if this post is unread

message_parsed.description: HTML parsed version of the message contents.

Thread.description: If requested by context, the thread this post is part of.

Attachments.description: Attachments to this post, if it has any.

is_reacted_to.description: True if the viewing user has reacted to this content

visitor_reaction_id.description: If the viewer reacted, the ID of the reaction they used

can_content_vote.description: True if the viewing user can vote on this content

allowed_content_vote_types.description: List of content vote types allowed on this content

is_content_voted.description: True if the viewing user has voted on this content

visitor_content_vote.description: If the viewer reacted, the vote they case (up/down)

message_parsed.description: HTML parsed version of the message contents.

ProfileUser.description: If requested by context, the user this profile post was left for.

Attachments.description: Attachments to this profile post, if it has any.

LatestComments.description: If requested, the most recent comments on this profile post.

is_reacted_to.description: True if the viewing user has reacted to this content

visitor_reaction_id.description: If the viewer reacted, the ID of the reaction they used

message_parsed.description: HTML parsed version of the message contents.

Attachments.description: Attachments to this profile post, if it has any.

ProfilePost.description: If requested by context, the profile post this comment relates to.

is_reacted_to.description: True if the viewing user has reacted to this content

visitor_reaction_id.description: If the viewer reacted, the ID of the reaction they used

is_watching.description: If accessing as a user, true if they are watching this thread

visitor_post_count.description: If accessing as a user, the number of posts they have made in this thread

is_unread.description: If accessing as a user, true if this thread is unread

custom_fields.description: Key-value pairs of custom field values for this thread

prefix.description: Present if this thread has a prefix. Printable name of the prefix.

index_state.description: Present for members with permission to change the search index state of this thread.

Forum.description: If requested by context, the forum this thread was posted in.

can_content_vote.description: True if the viewing user can vote on this content

allowed_content_vote_types.description: List of content vote types allowed on this content

is_content_voted.description: True if the viewing user has voted on this content

visitor_content_vote.description: If the viewer reacted, the vote they case (up/down)

field_choices.description: For choice types, an ordered list of choices, with "option" and "name" keys for each.

display_group.description: If this field type supports grouping, the group this field belongs to.

is_usable.description: True if the acting user can use (select) this prefix.

materialized_order.description: Effective order, taking group ordering into account.

User.description: Information about the user. Different information will be included based on permissions and verbosity.

age.description: The user's current age. Only included if available.

avatar_urls.description: Maps from size types to URL.

profile_banner_urls.description: Maps from size types to URL.

custom_fields.description: Map of custom field keys and values.

custom_title.description: Will have a value if a custom title has been specifically set; prefer user_title instead.

dob.description: Date of birth with year, month and day keys.

is_followed.description: True if the visitor is following this user. Only included if visitor is not a guest.

is_ignored.description: True if the visitor is ignoring this user. Only included if visitor is not a guest.

last_activity.description: Unix timestamp of user's last activity, if available.
